hint.text:
Terms common to both the numerator and denominator can be cancelled.
For example :
\(\frac{x^3abc}{xab},\,\)where x, a, b, c are non-zero integers; can be expressed as
\('x^2c'\,\)because \('xab'\,\)is the common term for the numerator and denominator.

solution.text:
\(\frac{_{j}_x^3y-_{k}_xy*4}{-xy}\)
Taking \(-xy\,\)common from the numerator,
\(=\frac{-xy(_{k}_y^3-_{j}_x^2)}{-xy}\)
Dividing numerator and denominator by \(-xy\),
\(=_{k}_y^3-_{j}_x^2\)
